docs.text:
Overview


Ticket Service aims to provide an easy to use service for the creation and authetication of tickets.


Commands




mkdocs new [dir-name]
 - Create a new project.


mkdocs serve
 - Start the live-reloading docs server.


mkdocs build
 - Build the documentation site.


mkdocs help
 - Print this help message.




Project layout


mkdocs.yml    # The configuration file.
docs/
    index.md  # The documentation homepage.
    ...       # Other markdown pages, images and other files.

docs.text:
Create Ticket


The service receives information and uses it to create a ticket. To do this a valid payment receipt has to be sent to the service.


The ticket is returned to the client and a new block is added to the blockchain.


GET /TicketGenerator/createTicket




Request


Content-type: application/json




{
    "secret": "secret",
    "details": {
        "purpose": "Transportation ticket",
        "company": "Transdev",
        "seat": "A45",
        "destinations": "Aveiro",
        "price": 0
    }
}










Field


Description


Type










secret


Value to use when creating the hash


String






details


Aditional information about the ticket


Object








Response


If successful, the response body contains a newly created instance of Ticket.


Content-type: application/json




{
    "ticket_id": 0,
    "timestamp": "2019-10-14T10:04:30.651Z",
    "details": {
        "purpose": "Transportation ticket",
        "company": "Transdev",
        "seat": "A45",
        "destinations": "Aveiro",
        "price": 0
    },
    "hash": "afd49088c68c2c17c329aedd6fbbe53a4d16b0ee8f187",
    "status": "inactive"
}










Field


Meaning


Type










ticket_id


Ticket id number


Integer






timestamp


Timestamp for when the ticket was created


Date






details


Aditional information about the ticket


Object






hash


Hash to check ticket integraty


String






status


Specifies if the ticket is disabled, validated or expired


String








Validate Ticket


The service extracts the ticket information from a QR code, checks to see if the integrity of the ticket is valid through the hash and returns a response based on the ticket's status. 


If it hasn't been validated yet a new block will be added to the blockchain using the updated ticket information. If the ticket has already been validated no new block will be added.


PUT /TicketGenerator/validateTicket




Request


Content-type: application/json




{   
  "secret": "secret",
  "ticket": {
    "ticket_id": 0,
    "timestamp": "2019-10-14T10:03:57.756Z",
    "details": {
      "purpose": "Transportation ticket",
      "company": "Transdev",
      "seat": "A45",
      "destinations": "Aveiro",
      "price": 0
    },
    "hash": "afd49088c68c2c17c329aedd6fbbe53a4d16b0ee8f187",
    "status": "inactive"
  }
}










Field


Meaning


Type










secret


Value to use when creating the hash


String






ticket


Ticket to be validated


Object








Response


When validating a ticket, there are 2 different successful responses. When the ticket's status is inactive the response body contains an updated instance of the ticket with a new status value and hash.


Content-type: application/json




{
    "ticket_id": 0,
    "timestamp": "2019-10-14T10:04:30.666Z",
    "details": {
      "purpose": "Transportation ticket",
      "company": "Transdev",
      "seat": "A45",
      "destinations": "Aveiro",
      "price": 0
    },
    "hash": "afd49088c68c2c17c329aedd6fbbe53a4d16b0ee8f187",
    "status": "validated"
}










Field


Meaning


Type










ticket_id


Ticket id number


Integer






user_id


User id number


Integer






timestamp


Timestamp for when the ticket was created


Date






details


Aditional information about the ticket


Object






hash


Hash to check ticket integraty


String






status


Specifies if the ticket is inactive, validated or expired


String








When the ticket's status is validated an ok is returned.








Error


Meaning










200


Ticket has been validated successfully.






201


Ticket is currently valid.








If the ticket can't be validated an error is returned.








Error


Meaning










404


Invalid ticket






405


Ticket has expired
